quiz.title: Algebra 2: Unit 9 Quiz 10
quiz.subtitle: 9.10: Expected Value and Its Applications
quiz.subject: Mathematics
quiz.topic: Calculating the average outcome of a random process

questions.question: A game involves rolling a fair six-sided die. You win \$12 if you roll a 6, and you win \$0 for any other number. What is the expected value of a single roll?
An insurance company sells a policy for \$500. If the policyholder has a claim, the company pays \$10,000. If the probability of a claim is 2%, what is the expected profit for the company per policy?
questions.explanation: The company gets \$500 no matter what. There is a 2% chance they lose \$10,000. E(X) = \$500 - (0.02 × \$10,000) = \$500 - \$200 = \$300 profit.

questions.question: A spinner has three sections: Red (50%), Blue (30%), and Green (20%). If Red pays \$2, Blue pays \$5, and Green pays \$10, what is the expected payout?
In a game, you have a 1/10 chance of winning \$100 and a 9/10 chance of losing \$5. What is the expected value of playing this game once?
A raffle sells 1,000 tickets at \$5 each. There is one grand prize worth \$1,000. What is the expected value of one ticket (considering the cost to play)?
questions.explanation: Value = (1/1000 × \$1000) - \$5 cost = \$1 - \$5 = -\$4.00. On average, a player loses \$4 per ticket.

questions.question: A basketball player is in a '1-and-1' free throw situation. If he makes the first (60% chance), he gets to shoot a second. If he misses the first, he gets 0 points. Each shot is worth 1 point. What is his expected number of points?
What does an expected value of \$0.00 indicate about a game?
options: The game is 'fair' (no advantage to player or house)
The player will never win money
The player will win every time
The game is impossible to play
questions.explanation: A 'fair game' is defined as a game where the expected value of the profit is zero.

questions.question: An investor is looking at a stock. There is a 40% chance it gains \$5,000 and a 60% chance it loses \$2,000. What is the expected gain/loss?

A test has a penalty for guessing. You get 1 point for a correct answer and -0.25 points for an incorrect answer. If a question has 5 options and you guess randomly, what is the expected value for that question?
A warranty for a laptop costs \$100. There is a 5% chance the laptop will need a \$1,500 repair. What is the expected value of the warranty for the customer?

scoreMessages.90: Excellent! You have a great grasp of mathematical expectation.
scoreMessages.70: Good work. Remember to subtract the 'cost to play' when calculating net profit!
scoreMessages.50: Keep practicing the sum of (Outcome × Probability).
scoreMessages.0: Expected value is the average outcome. Try calculating a few more and see the pattern!
